posts.post_content:
@blink182zombies  
If you check out "competitive" edh decklists, they tend to run very similar decklists, no matter the general. A lot of Spikes end up making the same decks over and over. More than anyone else, Spikes need a good reason to make a new deck, and try out new cards.  
Do the spikes do that? Sometimes.  
Anyway, is this going to be Sarkhan's girl?
posts.html:
@blink182zombies

Do the spikes do that? Sometimes.
Anyway, is this going to be Sarkhan's girl?

Posted By: Axelle (8/13/2011 11:06:05 AM)

posts.post_content:
She needs a [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak)!
  
   
The only other thing missing from Kaalia in EDH is more card draw to make sure you have enough crazy creatures to dump. [Promise of Power](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Promise of Power) is great, [Moonlight Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moonlight Bargain) is pretty good, and a [Wheel of Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wheel of Fortune) and the cheatable [Dragon Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Mage) are absolute musts.
  
   
Oh, and [World at War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=World at War).
posts.html:
She needs a Whispersilk Cloak!

The only other thing missing from Kaalia in EDH is more card draw to make sure you have enough crazy creatures to dump. Promise of Power is great, Moonlight Bargain is pretty good, and a Wheel of Fortune and the cheatable Dragon Mage are absolute musts.

Oh, and World at War.

posts.post_content: The only thing I don't like is how very linear EDH decks with her commanding it are going to be. Play Kaalia, cheat big creature into play, beat face, repeat. Which isn't to say she isn't an amazing, awesome card and commander, it's just that she doesn't really lend to the most varied of strategies.

Posted By: Cyberium (6/17/2011 12:52:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
There are so many good things to put onto the battlefield with this creature.  
  
[Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath), [Archangel of Strife](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archangel of Strife) or [Iona, Shield of Emeria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona, Shield of Emeria).  
  
[Demon of Death's Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demon of Death's Gate), [Kuro, Pitlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kuro, Pitlord) or [Pestilence Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence Demon).  
  
[Dragon Tyrant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Tyrant), [Bogardan Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bogardan Hellkite), or [Vampiric Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampiric Dragon).  
  
Those are some of my favourites, but a Commander deck using this card wants lots of powerful Angels, Demons, and Dragons to put into play with Kaalia.
posts.html:
There are so many good things to put onto the battlefield with this creature.

Akroma, Angel of Wrath, Archangel of Strife or Iona, Shield of Emeria.

Demon of Death's Gate, Kuro, Pitlord or Pestilence Demon.

Dragon Tyrant, Bogardan Hellkite, or Vampiric Dragon.

Those are some of my favourites, but a Commander deck using this card wants lots of powerful Angels, Demons, and Dragons to put into play with Kaalia.

Posted By: TheSwarm (6/18/2011 11:10:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A horrifyingly good commander to be sure.  
  
The strategy with her: R.P.K.C. (Reanimate, Protect, Kill, Creatures)  
  
Reanimate: Trust me, the kill spells will fly out of hands early and often. [Reya Dawnbringer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reya Dawnbringer), [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites) (so good, don't underestimate flashback), [Torrent of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Torrent of Souls), [Karmic Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Karmic Guide) (now an angel!), and of course [Phyrexian Reclamation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Reclamation) are all fantastic options that you don't see in many current Kaalia decks.  
  
Protect: I'll spare you the ton of ways to protect her, but two big ones are [Emerge Unscathed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emerge Unscathed), because it often leads to 3 protected attacks and [Apostle's Blessing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Apostle's Blessing) for the colorless quality. Of course equips can play in here as well, but I'm a fan of instant speed.  
  
Kill: Get rid of the blockers and future attackers, duh. [Phyrexian Purge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Purge) has been a particularly awesome one for me, gets rid of the early... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
A horrifyingly good commander to be sure.

The strategy with her: R.P.K.C. (Reanimate, Protect, Kill, Creatures)

Reanimate: Trust me, the kill spells will fly out of hands early and often. Reya Dawnbringer, Unburial Rites (so good, don't underestimate flashback), Torrent of Souls, Karmic Guide (now an angel!), and of course Phyrexian Reclamation are all fantastic options that you don't see in many current Kaalia decks.

Protect: I'll spare you the ton of ways to protect her, but two big ones are Emerge Unscathed, because it often leads to 3 protected attacks and Apostle's Blessing for the colorless quality. Of course equips can play in here as well, but I'm a fan of instant speed.

Kill: Get rid of the blockers and future attackers, duh. Phyrexian Purge has been a particularly awesome one for me, gets rid of the early... (see all)

Posted By: Ladon--- (8/23/2011 11:09:56 AM)

posts.post_content:
Play Kaalia  
  
Attack w/Kaalia; put [Lord of the Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Pit) into play tapped and attacking  
  
Next turn, sacrifice Kaalia to Lord of the Pit  
  
**...who's the commander *now*, puny human??**  
  
Lose your Lord of the Pit to whatever  
  
Replay Kaalia from command zone; put Reya Dawnbringer into play  
  
Dawnbring the Lord of the Pit back to play  
  
Next turn, sacrifice Kaalia to Lord of the pit  
  
**I wasn't finished with you!**
